meeting.title: Accessibility in Tech: Building Inclusive Products
meeting.description: A demo meeting showcasing SignTogether's accessibility features

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Good morning everyone! Welcome to our accessibility workshop. Today we'll be discussing how to build more inclusive products.

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: Thanks Sarah. I'm excited to share some insights from the deaf community perspective on product design.

transcripts.speaker: Jordan Kim
transcripts.text: I'd love to hear about technical implementations. What are the biggest challenges we face when building accessible features?

transcripts.speaker: Taylor Johnson
transcripts.text: Great question Jordan. One major challenge is ensuring our solutions work across different assistive technologies.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: Let's start with captions. Alex, can you tell us about your experience with live captioning in meetings?

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: Absolutely. Real-time captions are crucial for participation. The accuracy and speed make a huge difference in following conversations.

transcripts.speaker: Jordan Kim
transcripts.text: What about gesture recognition? How important is it to detect sign language in video calls?

transcripts.speaker: Taylor Johnson
transcripts.text: It's revolutionary. When the system can identify who's signing, it helps hearing participants know who's speaking.

transcripts.speaker: Alex Rivera
transcripts.text: Exactly. And detecting common gestures like 'yes' or 'no' can speed up communication significantly.

transcripts.speaker: Sarah Chen
transcripts.text: That's fascinating. How do we ensure these AI systems are trained on diverse sign languages and dialects?

gestures.description: Thank you gesture in response to comment

summary.meeting_summary: This accessibility workshop focused on building inclusive products for deaf and hearing users. Key discussion points included the importance of real-time captions, gesture recognition technology, and ensuring AI systems work with diverse sign languages. Participants shared insights on technical implementation challenges and the impact of accessibility features on user participation.
action_items: Research diverse sign language datasets for AI training
Test gesture recognition across different cultural contexts
Create accessibility guidelines for development teams
key_points: Real-time captions are crucial for deaf participation in meetings
Gesture recognition helps identify active speakers in sign language
AI systems need training on diverse sign languages and dialects
Accessibility features benefit all users, not just those with disabilities
